abstract: Returns the attributes of the item at a given path.

declaration.code: func attributesOfItem(atPath path: String) throws -> [FileAttributeKey : Any]

overview:
## Return Value

A dictionary object that describes the attributes (file, directory, symlink, and so on) of the file specified by `path` (or `nil` if an error occurred in Objective-C). The keys in the dictionary are described in `File Attribute Keys`.

## Discussion

If the item at the path is a symbolic link—that is, the value of the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileAttributeKey/type] key in the attributes dictionary is [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileAttributeType/typeSymbolicLink]—you can use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileManager/destinationOfSymbolicLink(atPath:)] method to retrieve the path of the item pointed to by the link. You can also use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSString/resolvingSymlinksInPath] method of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSString] to resolve links in the path before retrieving the item’s attributes.

As a convenience, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary] provides a set of methods (declared as a category on [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary]) for quickly and efficiently obtaining attribute information from the returned dictionary: [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileGroupOwnerAccountName()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileModificationDate()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileOwnerAccountName()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/filePosixPermissions()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileSize()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileSystemFileNumber()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileSystemNumber()], and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileType()].

### Discussion

# attributesOfItem(atPath:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the attributes of the item at a given path.

## Declaration

```swift
func attributesOfItem(atPath path: String) throws -> [FileAttributeKey : Any]
```

## Parameters

- **path**: The path of a file or directory.

## Return Value

A dictionary object that describes the attributes (file, directory, symlink, and so on) of the file specified by `path` (or `nil` if an error occurred in Objective-C). The keys in the dictionary are described in `File Attribute Keys`.

## Discussion

If the item at the path is a symbolic link—that is, the value of the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileAttributeKey/type] key in the attributes dictionary is [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileAttributeType/typeSymbolicLink]—you can use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileManager/destinationOfSymbolicLink(atPath:)] method to retrieve the path of the item pointed to by the link. You can also use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSString/resolvingSymlinksInPath] method of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSString] to resolve links in the path before retrieving the item’s attributes.

As a convenience, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary] provides a set of methods (declared as a category on [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary]) for quickly and efficiently obtaining attribute information from the returned dictionary: [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileGroupOwnerAccountName()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileModificationDate()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileOwnerAccountName()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/filePosixPermissions()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileSize()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileSystemFileNumber()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileSystemNumber()], and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileType()].

### Discussion



## Getting and setting attributes

- **componentsToDisplay(forPath:)**: Returns an array of strings representing the user-visible components of a given path.
- **displayName(atPath:)**: Returns the display name of the file or directory at a specified path.
- **attributesOfFileSystem(forPath:)**: Returns a dictionary that describes the attributes of the mounted file system on which a given path resides.
- **setAttributes(_:ofItemAtPath:)**: Sets the attributes of the specified file or directory.
